title: Ticket #6262: Parse splices lazily
description:
(I thought there was already a ticket for this, but I'm not finding one. Hopefully I'm not creating a duplicate.)

Anyhow, one of the main advantages of sub-DAGs over splices is that sub-DAGs are parsed lazily. Since we'd like to encourage the use of splices, and make splices and sub-DAGs as much alike as possible, it would be great to parse splices lazily rather than eagerly as they are now.

One obstacle to this is splice connections (#5213) -- possibly we'd just disallow lazy parsing if you have splice connections?

(Also see #6048: Have separate Dag objects for splices? and #3587: Add "socket" nodes for splices.)
remarks:
2017-May-16 13:31:21 by wenger:
Seems like having socket nodes implemented would make this a lot easier -- we could create the appropriate socket nodes in the parent DAG object when we parse that DAG, and they could kind of be "placeholders"; then, when we parse the splice DAG file, we'd insert the appropriate nodes between the socket nodes.
